question: This metric measures how long it takes new users to recognize the value of a new product.

tipsAndFeedback.chosenFeedback: That’s not correct. The revenue growth rate measures the percentage increase in revenue as a result of introducing a new product.
That’s not correct. Return on investment (ROI) is a performance measure used to evaluate the profitability of new product development.
That’s not correct. The product adoption rate is the moment when users start to use your product’s features to accomplish the goals it was developed to address.
Time to value is a critical metric that measures how long it takes new users to recognize the value of your product.

detailedSolution: Time to value is a critical metric that measures how long it takes new users to recognize the value of your product.
